group.label: Product Structured Data (Schema.org)

field.label: Brand Attribute Code
field.comment: Enter the product attribute code for brand (e.g., "brand" or "manufacturer"). Leave empty to use "manufacturer" as fallback.

field.label: GTIN/EAN Attribute Code
field.comment: Enter the product attribute code for GTIN/EAN/UPC (e.g., "ean", "gtin", "upc"). Leave empty if not used.

field.label: MPN Attribute Code
field.comment: Enter the product attribute code for Manufacturer Part Number (MPN). Leave empty if not used.

field.label: Condition Attribute Code
field.comment: Enter the product attribute code for product condition. Values should be: "new", "used", "refurbished", or "damaged". Leave empty to default to "NewCondition".

field.label: Color Attribute Code
field.comment: Enter the product attribute code for color. Defaults to "color" if left empty.

field.label: Material Attribute Code
field.comment: Enter the product attribute code for material (e.g., "material"). Leave empty if not used.

field.label: Energy Efficiency Attribute Code
field.comment: EU Energy Label attribute (e.g., "energy_efficiency"). Values: A+++, A++, A+, A, B, C, D, E, F, G. Leave empty if not used.

field.label: Default Shipping Rate
field.comment: Default shipping cost (e.g., 5.99). Leave empty if free shipping.

field.label: Shipping Transit Days
field.comment: E.g., "3-5" for 3-5 business days, or "2" for 2 days.

field.label: Shipping Destination Country
field.comment: Leave empty to use default country.

field.label: Return Window (Days)
field.comment: Number of days for returns (default: 14)

field.label: Return Policy Country
field.comment: Leave empty to use default country.

group.comment: Add OpenGraph meta tags for better social media sharing (Facebook, LinkedIn, etc.).

field.label: Auto-add Sitemap URLs?
field.comment: Automatically append sitemap URLs from the XML Sitemap configuration.

field.label: Additional Sitemap URLs

group.label: Google Content Grouping
group.comment:
Google content grouping allows you to group certain types of content found on your site so that you can use this information in Google Analytics. For example you could find out how many of your total visits where to product pages, category pages or CMS pages. For more information visit this link: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/2853423?hl=en

Within this extension we have allowed you to add tracking code for products, categories and CMS pages. To set up your tracking codes go to your Analytics dashboard and go to Admin > Content Grouping > + New Content Grouping. Give it a name (such as 'Product Page'), and then from the options choose 'Enable Tracking Code', then copy and past the Universal tracking code into the Product field below.

field.label: Product Tracking Code
field.comment: E.g. ga('set', 'contentGroup1', 'Product Page');

field.label: Category Tracking Code
field.comment: E.g. ga('set', 'contentGroup1', 'Category Page');

field.label: CMS Page Tracking Code
field.comment: E.g. ga('set', 'contentGroup1', 'CMS Page');
